subject: Leadership
title: The Five Dysfunctions of a Team
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Five Dysfunctions of a Team usable.

hook.text: A talented team keeps failing. They have skill, resources, and opportunity. The problem is in their dynamics.

buildup.text: Lencioni's pyramid: absence of trust, fear of conflict, lack of commitment, avoidance of accountability, poor results.

discovery.text: Each dysfunction builds on the one below. Without trust, no honest conflict. Without conflict, no real commitment.

twist.text: Most teams try to fix results firstâ€”the top of the pyramid. But the real fix always starts at the base: trust.

climax.text: Leaders diagnose by asking: does my team debate openly? Hold each other accountable? Prioritize team over ego?

punchline.text: Fix the foundation and the results follow.

quiz.question: What is the base of Lencioni's five dysfunctions pyramid?
